stem: Loss of sensation over the anteromedial leg extending to the medial foot most specifically indicates injury to which branch of the femoral nerve?
rationale_correct: The saphenous nerve (branch of femoral) supplies anteromedial leg and medial foot cutaneous sensation.

rationale_distractors.A: Lateral femoral cutaneous supplies lateral thigh skin.
rationale_distractors.B: Obturator cutaneous branch supplies a small medial thigh area.
rationale_distractors.D: Superficial fibular supplies anterolateral leg and dorsum of foot.
rationale_distractors.E: Sural supplies posterolateral leg and lateral foot.

evidence.citation: Heck C. Lower Limb Overview Handout â€” Cutaneous nerves. Jun 16, 2025.
